transcripts.text: Do not send your children to the border.  If they do make it, they'll get sent back.  More importantly, they might not make it.  So what do you think about those quotes?
Well, Trump is for himself.  He has no compassion for people.
What if I told you those quotes are actually Obama quotes?  One was from 2014 and one was from 2008.  Yeah, they were from President Obama.  What do you think about that?
Well, I didn't, I never, well...

Hi this is Matt Miller for the Daily Call The News Foundation and today we're asking people in Washington D.C.  what they think of the President's quotes on immigration.  The thing is they're actually Obama's quotes on immigration from 2014.  Let's go see what they think.  So President Trump said, that is our direct message to families in Central America.  Do not send your children to the border.  If they do make it, they'll get sent back.  More importantly, they might not make it.  What do you think about that?
Um, that is, that sounds like a threat.
But if I actually told you that, um, president Obama said that in 2014, would your opinion like change about that?  Cause it was Obama said in 2014.
Yeah.
Well, my opinion doesn't change.  It's still like, that's not, that's still not okay.  That's still a direct threat.

So I wanted to read you a quote by president Trump.  So the quote goes undocumented workers, broker immigration laws, and must be held accountable.  especially those who may be dangerous.  That's why over the past six years, the deportation of criminals is up 80%.  What do you think about that?
Well, deportating criminals, I'm not actually American.  To single out immigrants is not fair.

To make out that all immigrants are criminals What if I told you that this quote was actually said by Obama in 2014?  So you cannot blame immigrants for whatever criminal activities are happening in the United States.  So actually Obama said this in 2014.  Do you have the same opinion now?
I'm sure there's an element of xenophobia in there.  You know, he's playing to his base, I guess.

What if I told you that this was actually an Obama quote from 2014?  He said this during his presidency in 2014.  Would that change your thoughts about it?  Not send your children to the border.  If they do make it, they'll get sent back.  More importantly, they might not make it.  What do you think about that?
He has psychological problems.  That's what I think.  Something's really not right with that.  To say that about children is really wrong.

Something's not right.  Actually, can I ask you, what if I told you it was actually Obama that said that in 2014?  Would that change?  And it was.  Does that change your opinion about, or your thoughts on the quote?
No.
It's still not right.
Still not right?  Yeah.  Were you not a fan of Obama's immigration policy?
I actually wasn't too clear on Obama's immigration policy.
